AI_QUALITY_FAILURES.reasoning: ATLAS provided information that was not relevant to the customer’s reported issue (lost handovers Flow → Care). The customer explicitly indicated the AI response did not help and was unrelated.
evidence: Chat Support: "### 🔥 Active Incidents for Khoros Classic\n\n1. Missing Community Analytics data since August 29"
Carsten Schmitt-Hoeppner: "👎 No. My issue is not related"

AI_WALL_LOOPING.reasoning: No evidence the customer was trapped in an AI loop (no repeated requests for the same info, no explicit request for a human with denial, and no long AI-only back-and-forth shown).

IGNORING_CONTEXT.reasoning: The human agent acknowledged the prior ticket and stated the issue was already escalated, and did not re-request logs/details already provided in this ticket.
evidence: Carlo Koh: "Please be advised that ticket 60195591 is still open and we are actively working on resolving the issue through the said ticket."
Carlo Koh: "In the meantime, I have shared the additional information provided here to the original ticket."

RESPONSE_DELAYS.reasoning: Support responded within ~1 day in this ticket (Sep 12 to Sep 13). While the customer expresses frustration about lack of feedback, there is no clear 3+ day gap evidenced in this specific ticket timeline.
evidence: Customer: "I have reproted this issue but not received any feedback yet!"

PREMATURE_CLOSURE.reasoning: There is no evidence the ticket was closed; the agent explicitly states it will remain open for a week unless the customer requests closure.
evidence: Carlo Koh: "This ticket will stay open for one week unless you reply with \"This ticket can be closed\" or update the status to Completed in the portal."

P1_SEV1_MISHANDLING.reasoning: The customer indicates urgency/critical impact, and support shows appropriate prioritization by noting escalation to Engineering/Development rather than providing irrelevant basic troubleshooting.
evidence: Customer: "This situation is slowly becoming critical! We are losing customers and our reputation."
Carlo Koh (internal): "...is on hold as the issue was escalated to Engineering."
Carlo Koh (public): "The issue has already been escalated to our Development team and they are investigating the problem at this time."
